text:
expect that formality, but I'd like to confer.
Two teachers recently said that Max was getting Fs. Yesterday, we heard AD was not turning in work, and today, we hear that it likely
disqualifies him for advanced placement in math.
This is not stuff that happens during school hours. In both cases, it reflects their extracurricular and home life instead. Would you mind
sharing the plan to get them on track at home?
I want to partner with you on our messaging and guidance as parents, but I don't want to be overbearing and give them a double whammy. I
can also help AD if he is here visting.
Let me know how we can coordinate. It seems like SAAS is doing its part; it's just when they leave and go home that we have the challenge.
Let's make those Stanford trips worth something.
thanks in advance on the partnership to be the best parents we can for these guys!
On 12/18/2024 at 11:38 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/18/2024 at 11:44 AM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Marh
Sure. Your saying that his academic choices and whether to peruse advanced placement is none of my concern.
On 12/18/2024 at 11:32 AM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/18/2024 at 11:36 AM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Marh
Yes please ask Lisa if this is considered a major decision.
Also waiting for Lisa feedback on interpretation on payment of expenses prior to Oct 31, your medical expenses, the 52/48 split of msft vested
stock post Nov 1, and outstanding transfer of dividend in Msft account.
Thank you
On 12/18/2024 at 10:49 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/18/2024 at 11:26 AM)
Subject:Adrian’s Marh
I thought we were going to discuss decisions before you unilaterally made them for the children.
Should I ask for an interpretation or are you just ignoring our court order again?
Message 212 of 287
You own scheduling with Alan.
Sent:12/19/2024 at 03:25 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/19/2024 at 03:27 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Math
